docs.summary:
The wix-members module contains functionality
for working with your site members from frontend page code.
description: The frontend Wix Members API allows you to manage member access to your site
as well as view and manage the currently logged-in member.
To use the Wix Members API,
import the applicable named exports from `wix-members`:

Members returned by the Members API will not include custom fields from your site's contacts unless they are [added to your site Members in your site's dashboard](https://support.wix.com/en/article/customizing-your-member-profile-fields).
Otherwise, the custom fields will be included only in the Contacts.
To retrieve members' custom fields including private fields, pass the `suppressAuth` parameter in the request.
## Calling Members functions from the browser only

Wix usually uses [server-side rendering](https://support.wix.com/en/article/velo-about-the-page-rendering-process), to make your page load faster, but this may cause unwanted effects if functions are called both on the server side and on the client side, potentially with different results.
Most frontend members functions are typically only called from the browser.
The following example shows a simple addition to the `onReady()` function which ensures that ensures that code executed when the page has finished loading only runs on the browser.
When code is not run in the browser the check returns without any result.
Any other functions, like `getMember()`, after the check, will only run once, in the browser.
For more information on the `wixWindow.rendering.env` property, see [the API reference](https://www.wix.com/velo/reference/wix-window/rendering-obj/env).
